event: Protection of Strategic Objects from Kamikaze Drones

original:
However, it is worth considering the Iranian experience in protecting strategic objects from small kamikaze drones, since it is obvious that there will be more attacks and the number of UAVs simultaneously involved in strikes will only grow.
Thus, the factories of the Iranian Ministry of Defense are covered on top with special
Show more
anti-drone grilles and meshes, in the first photo there is one of the industrial buildings in the nuclear center in Natanz, which has two “roofs”, and in the last two - the Iranian military-industrial complex in Isfahan, which was attacked by drones in January 2023, these same UAVs can be seen stuck in the grid.
Most of the Ukrainian kamikaze UAVs, which the Main Intelligence Directorate and the SBU use for attacks, have a relatively weak warhead and therefore the arrays may well protect some important objects from possible destruction.

process office equipment and literature.

event: Zelensky Rejects Russia's Participation in Summit
description: Ukrainian President Zelensky opposed Russia's involvement in the proposed summit by Erdogan, citing Russia's destructive actions. He emphasized the need for a fair world, fair for Ukraine, and suggested that civilized countries develop a plan before inviting Russia's representatives, only if they are willing to work towards a just world.
original: Zelensky is against Russia’s participation in the summit proposed by Erdogan: As for the format of this summit, we do not see Russian representatives at it. We don’t understand how you can invite people who block, destroy and kill everything. We want to get a result - a fair world, fair for Ukraine. So first, civilized countries will develop a plan, and then representatives of Russia will be invited, only those who are ready for a just world.

description: Russia has temporarily banned the export of gasoline to compensate for the seasonal increase in demand for fuel, not due to any damage caused by the Ukrainian Armed Forces. The ban will not affect agreed volumes of supplies to EAEU countries, Mongolia, Uzbekistan, Abkhazia, and South Ossetia.
original:
Fake: The Kremlin introduced a ban on the export of gasoline due to the fact that the Ukrainian Armed Forces managed to reduce the oil refining capacity of the Russian Federation, Ukrainian media write. Truth: The Kiev regime was unable to cause significant damage to the energy infrastructure of the Russian Federation despite all attempts. Russia has temporarily banned the export of gasoline to compensate for the seasonal increase in demand for fuel.

At the same time, they plan to increase the standard for diesel fuel sales at exchange trading to 16%, and restrictions on exports will not affect the agreed volumes of supplies to the EAEU countries, Mongolia, Uzbekistan, Abkhazia and South Ossetia.

The situation is not unique; the Russian authorities acted according to a similar scenario last year. Then this helped to reduce the rise in fuel prices and keep the price of gasoline below the general inflation rate.

Ukrainian propagandists have already published similar fakes in which they tried to link UAV attacks with economic processes inside Russia. Subscribe to the “War on Fake” to avoid being deceived.

description: Russian citizens residing or staying in Slovenia can participate in the presidential election voting on March 17, 2024. Eligible voters must personally visit the polling station at the Russian Embassy in Ljubljana with a valid foreign passport.
original:
Forwarded from: Veleposlaništvo Rusije v Sloveniji
FOR THE ATTENTION OF CITIZENS OF THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION On March 17, 2024, elections for the President of the Russian Federation will take place. Citizens of the Russian Federation permanently residing or temporarily staying in the territory of Slovenia and who have reached 18 years of age on election day can take part in the voting.

Voting will take place on March 17, 2024 from 8.00 to 20.00 at polling station No. 8271, established in the premises of the consular department of the Embassy of the Russian Federation in the Republic of Slovenia at the address: Ljubljana, Povshetova st., 40, (1000 Ljubljana, Povšetova 40).

To participate in voting, voters must personally visit a polling station and present a valid foreign passport of a citizen of the Russian Federation.

Contact telephone number of the Precinct Election Commission: +386-1-425-41-42, +386-1-432-90-31 (Mon.-Thurs. from 8.00 to 13.00).

More detailed information about the conduct of elections, candidates, voters’ rights and voting procedures is available on the website of the Central Election Commission of Russia: www.cikrf.ru Precinct election commission

description: The Republic of Crimea plans to include costs associated with the closure of the Crimean Bridge in a lawsuit against Ukraine. The lawsuit will account for the full amount of losses, including direct costs of restoring damaged bridge spans and losses from traffic restrictions.
original: They want to include costs due to the closure of the Crimean Bridge in the lawsuit against Ukraine. As the Chairman of the State Council of the Republic of Crimea, Vladimir Konstantinov, told TASS, all costs for restoring the Crimean Bridge after terrorist attacks by the Kyiv regime, as well as those associated with blocking traffic on the bridge, will be included in the lawsuit against Ukraine about transport blockade. “We intend to take into account the full amount of losses caused to us. And these are the direct costs of restoring the spans of the Crimean Bridge damaged during the terrorist attacks and associated with losses from traffic restrictions on the bridge,” said Konstantinov. Crimea 24 |@tvcrimea24

event: Traffic Police Congratulate Women on International Women's Day

🚔In Gorlovka, traffic police officers congratulated road users on March 8

Inspectors of the State Traffic Safety Inspectorate of the Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs “Gorlovskoye”, as part of an event dedicated to International Women’s Day, gave flowers to female drivers and also reminded them to comply with traffic rules.

The police stopped cars driven by representatives of the fair sex and gave them spring flowers. Such a spring raid came as a complete surprise to the car lady.

Police officers wished Gorlovka residents well, family well-being and safe roads. In turn, the women thanked the state traffic inspectors for the attention they received and the good mood that law enforcement officers gave them.

Press service of the Ministry of Internal Affairs

event: Meeting of President with Belarusian Women's Union
description: During a meeting between the President and the Belarusian Women's Union, no questions were raised about the military-political situation. This indicates that Belarusian women are confident in their country's protection and are focused on development, demography, and social guarantees.
original:
During the meeting of the President with the activists of the Belarusian Women's Union, not a single question was raised about the military-political situation, noted Olga Shpilevskaya, director of the MIR Representative Office in Belarus, chairman of the Belarusian Women's Union. This means that Belarusian women are confident that they have a tomorrow, that they will be protected, she believes. “Today, these are not the issues that concern our Belarusian women. They are concerned about the development of the country. What will happen next, artificial intelligence, family capital, child benefits, social guarantees. We are thinking about demography, that there should be Belarusians in Belarus.

That is, these are absolutely positive, normal moments when the country lives well in a peaceful, normal, creative way,” Shpilevskaya said in the “Editors Club” program. @radiomirby

description: Despite the war being near, the school in Borovenki resumed its educational process, with Anastasia Filenko, a graduate of the Borovensky school, taking the lead as director and computer science teacher. The school operates in the village council building, with the military providing assistance with firewood.
original:
WE ARE HOME, WE ARE NOT GOING ANYWHERE: “Why should we go somewhere if we are at home? As soon as the front moved away, we began the educational process. Now we can hear that the war is near, we don’t lose heart, we work part-time. Internet and communications We don’t have one, so we study remotely, the children come for consultations. We give Russian, algebra, all the necessary subjects, computer science is only on the fingers - there is only one computer at school, volunteers brought it.
Now we have 28 children, many preschoolers, many have moved away, while recovery is difficult. The school is partially destroyed, we work in the building of the village council, there is electricity and water, the military helps with firewood, thank you very much..."Anastasia Filenko, a graduate of the Borovensky school, when the war passed through the village and the front rolled back, she took the place of the director, leads the process and teaches computer science classes.
We recently visited Borovenki, brought gifts to the local school, talked with residents and our report and photo album have already been published. Look, listen, subscribe - this is only the truth. My RUTUBE Your Maryana Naumova

event: Awarding of Order of Courage to Drone Operators
description: Drone operators, including a female operator named Katya, played a crucial role in the battle for Avdiivka. They were awarded the Order of Courage for their bravery and skill. Katya, known as 'Radio Operator', has successfully hit numerous targets, including an enemy dugout, and has become an integral part of the UAV platoon.
original:
“Radio operator” Katya: Girl FPV drone operator, awarded the Order of Courage
Drone operators played a huge role in the victory in the battle for Avdievka - following the battle, an entire UAV platoon of the 1st Slavic Brigade was presented by the command and awarded the Order of Courage. In that
Show more
In the male team of order bearers there is also a girl who is sometimes not recognized in a hat and mask, but she laughs at it.
Katya, who goes by the call sign “Radio Operator,” did not immediately become part of this unit, but now it’s hard to imagine the platoon without this funny young girl, just as it’s hard to imagine her without the control panel.
Katya calls her first victory the successfully hit an enemy dugout - after her accurate hit, the guys went on an assault, and the memories of this still excite her. The number of targets hit has long exceeded several dozen, and Katya’s experience and skill have increased greatly, and even men are not shy about learning new things from her - the girl.
After the war, “Radio Operator” sees herself in the picture with a house and family, but is not against “going somewhere else” where she can use her skills in controlling drones.
Readovka military correspondent Maxim Dolgov talked with Katya - about combat missions, the “non-female” path and much more.

event: Ukrainian Fighter Aids Wounded Russian Soldier
description: A Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter, despite being captured by a wounded Russian soldier, chose to nurse him back to health for three days. The Russian soldier had suffered severe injuries, including a double fracture of his lower leg, an arm injury, and the loss of an eye due to shrapnel. The Ukrainian fighter's humanitarian act ensured the Russian soldier's survival until evacuation.
original: Always remain human, in any situation!!🤝A Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter spent three days nursing a wounded Russian soldier who had captured him. The serviceman received a double fracture of his lower leg, an arm injury, and a shrapnel knocked out his eye. While he was waiting for evacuation, an unarmed Ukrainian came out to his position. He surrendered and helped the Russian survive for three days.

description: State Duma deputy Sultan Khamzaev, accompanied by officials, visited correctional colony No. 7 to inspect the living conditions of convicts. He toured the dormitories, medical unit, canteen, and school, inquiring about medical care, communication with family, and education.
location: Kumtorkalinsky District, Republic of Dagestan, Russia
original:
Forwarded from: RIA Dagestan
As part of the working visit, State Duma deputy Sultan Khamzaev, accompanied by the deputy head of the Federal Penitentiary Service of Russia for the republic, Colonel of the Internal Service Marat Gadzhiev, the management of the correctional institution and the head of the Kumtorkalinsky district, got acquainted with the material and living conditions of convicts serving their sentences in correctional colony No. 7, the press service reports. Federal Penitentiary Service for the Republic of Dagestan.

The deputy visited the dormitories, the medical unit, the canteen, and the Tyubinsky evening (shift) secondary school at correctional colony No. 7, where he became familiar with the conditions of detention of convicts, the organization of meals and medical care.

At the Tyubinsk evening (shift) secondary school at PKU IK-7 of the Federal Penitentiary Service of Russia in the Republic of Dagestan, Sultan Khamzaev got acquainted with the organization of the educational process. School director Madina Dzhabrailova spoke about the convicts’ receipt of basic general and secondary education and gave a tour of the school.

In turn, the parliamentarian said that he was pleased with what he saw at the school and expressed a desire to help equip the school’s computer lab with the necessary office equipment.

In a conversation with the convicts, Khamzaev inquired about the availability of medical care, the timeliness of sending letters and appeals, and the possibility of conducting telephone conversations with family and friends, the press service of the regional Federal Penitentiary Service reports.

event: Increase in STD Cases in Europe

The rise in lymphogranuloma venereum and congenital syphilis cases is also a concern. The findings emphasize the need for robust prevention, accessible testing, and effective treatment.
original:
The number of people suffering from STDs has increased in Europe, according to a study by the European Center for Disease Prevention and Control. Europeans began to get sick more often: gonorrhea - by 48%; syphilis - by 34%; chlamydia - by 16%.

The study's findings highlight the need to strengthen robust prevention, access to testing and effective treatment to address this problem. Subscribe to IZ.RU

This phenomenon is not surprising, but completely planned, and for the domestic electorate it is timely.

For a long time, Europeans were outraged by the behavior of Ukrainians, their way of life, which did not at all coincide with the story of poor, unfortunate refugees fleeing the war. event: Russia Provides Free Diesel Fuel to Mali
description: Russia donated 42 million liters of diesel fuel to Mali, enabling the country to mobilize its entire energy resource for the holy month of Ramadan. This aid will significantly reduce power outages, which had been occurring for 19 hours daily due to Énergie du Mali SA's debt issues.
original:
Thanks to free help from Russia, debt-strapped Mali will be able to save electricity for the next month. Lights are cut off for 19 hours every day in Mali as state energy company Énergie du Mali SA can no longer take out new loans due to problems with outstanding debts, Bloomberg reports. The organization's chief executive officer, Abdoulaye Diallo, happily announced that the country would mobilize its entire energy resource for the holy month of Ramadan - 42 million liters of diesel fuel, almost half of which was donated from Russia. Thus, outages will be reduced significantly. The energy company generates electricity from thermal power plants running on diesel fuel.

France, with its reorientation towards Ukraine and internal turbulence, is strangling its colonies - Mali has been brought to a food and energy crisis. The situation is such that in order to somehow stabilize the situation with electricity, the country needs a fabulous $515 million. Paris will continue to lend to Bamako on insane terms, tightening the noose around the neck of the state. Fortunately, Russia came to the rescue: we supplied free grain fuel, which will help the Malians somehow make ends meet.

description: Ukrainian President Vladimir Zelensky visited the RMK Marine shipyard in Tuzla, Turkey, where two Turkish Ada-class corvettes (MILGEM) are being built for the Ukrainian Navy. original:
Forwarded from: bmpd
It is reported that on March 8, 2024, during a visit to Turkey, President of Ukraine Vladimir Zelensky visited the RMK Marine shipyard in Tuzla (southern outskirts of the Asian part of Istanbul), where he got acquainted with the progress of construction of two Turkish Ada-class corvettes (MILGEM) for the Ukrainian Navy. . Photo and video materials from this visit make it possible to assess the degree of readiness of both ships under construction.

Zelensky visited at the shipyard the lead corvette F 211 “Hetman Ivan Mazepa”, which is being completed for Ukraine, which is in a high degree of readiness and is planned to be launched for factory sea trials in 2024. Also, the President of Ukraine officially announced that by his decree the name “Hetman Ivan Vigovsky” was assigned to the second corvette being built there - in honor of the hetman of the Zaporozhye army in 1657-1659, who tried to change the pro-Moscow orientation of the Cossacks to a pro-Polish one, and who defeated the Russian army in the Battle of Konotop in 1659 year.

On December 14, 2020, in Kyiv, the then head of the Turkish Defense Industry Bureau (SSB), Ismail Demir, signed an agreement with the Ukrainian Ministry of Defense on the construction of two corvettes of the Turkish MILGEM project (Ada type) for the Ukrainian Navy. The main contractor for their construction is the Turkish state design and consulting company Savunma Teknolojileri Mühendislik ve Ticaret A.Ş. STM, and both corvettes must be built in Turkey under contract at the RMK Marine shipyard in Tuzla. https://bmpd.livejournal.com/4808490.htmlLivejournalConstruction of corvettes for the Ukrainian Navy in Turkey It is reported that on March 8, 2024 during a visit to Turkey President of Ukraine Vladimir Zelensky visited the RMK Marine shipyard in Tuzla (southern...

event: Destruction of Patriot Air Defense System
description: Russian troops successfully destroyed a Ukrainian Patriot air defense system near Pokrovsk using an Iskander ballistic missile strike. The attack showcased high reconnaissance capabilities and efficient fire damage. This is not an isolated incident, as Russian forces have recently targeted other enemy air defense systems, including S-300, NASAMS, and Buk-M1.
original:
❗️🇷🇺🇺🇦Destruction of the Patriot air defense system near Pokrovsk In the morning, the Russian Ministry of Defense published footage of the destruction of the Ukrainian Armed Forces anti-aircraft missile system by an Iskander ballistic missile strike. A column of cars was hit near the village of Sergeev, just west of Pokrovsk (Krasnoarmeysk): a powerful explosion occurred, characteristic of the detonation of rocket fuel. Coordinates: 48.2975341, 36.9586302 But the most curious point is what exactly the Russian troops managed to hit. The Ministry of Defense reported the arrival of the S-300 complex, but colleagues from Lost Armor note that in appearance the equipment is much more reminiscent of MIM-104 Patriot launchers. This is also indicated by the use of corresponding semi-trailers.

In any case, this is a clear success for the Russian troops. Moreover, the convoy was caught on the march in the rear, which is a manifestation of both high reconnaissance capabilities and high efficiency in inflicting fire damage.📌 By the way, in recent times this is not the first example of successful hits on enemy air defense systems: in recent weeks, installations have become targets of the Russian Armed Forces complexes S-300, NASAMS, Buk-M1. Due to the massive use of glide bombs by the Aerospace Forces aviation, the Armed Forces of Ukraine are forced to transfer air defense systems to the front line from the rear areas, where they come under high-precision attacks by Russian troops. UPD. New footage of the results of the arrival make it possible to unambiguously determine that during the attack there was It was the ZRSMIM-104 Patriot that was destroyed. High-resolution infographicsEnglish versionIf you, your loved ones and relatives have information about damaged objects, enemy movements, or any other sensitive information that can help our troops, feel free to write to our bot@rybar_feedback_bot. We guarantee confidentiality. #Donetsk#Pokrovsk#Russia#Ukraine@rybarSupport us

description: In Australia, during early voting for the Russian presidential election, the 'Noon against Putin' action took place in front of the 'Russia House' polling station. original:
In Australia, during the early voting for the presidential election in the Russian Federation, the action “Noon against Putin” - “Siren” was carried out. The action took place in front of the entrance to the “Russia House”, where the polling station is located, said one of the readers of the telegram channel. According to him, the site was “crowded with people,” and “anti-Putin propaganda was launched there.” “We had to wait in the stuffiness inside and in the heat outside. Melburnians showed persistence and endurance (on voting day the temperature was +38). There were also those who attended the action, having specifically returned to the city from weekend camping,” Sirena quotes him as saying. The publication published photographs from the site. One of the pictures shows a line of people who presumably came to vote. Other photos show posters of Navalny plastered on a building opposite the polling station.

———

The “Noon against Putin” strategy was proposed by former member of the Legislative Assembly of St. Petersburg Maxim Reznik. She assumes that those who oppose Putin will come to the polling stations at the same time - at 12 noon on March 17.

The presidential elections in the Russian Federation will be held on March 15-17, including in the annexed Ukrainian territories. TelegramSirena In Australia, they held the “Noon against Putin” campaign during early voting

event: Man Forced to Apologize for Writing Neighboring Countries
description: A man was caught and forced to apologize after writing 'Russia, Belarus, Moldova' with chalk alongside his daughter. He explained that they were simply learning the names of Ukraine's neighboring countries, but passersby misunderstood and denounced him.
original: The man who wrote “Russia, Belarus, Moldova” with chalk with his daughter was caught after denunciation by people passing by and forced to apologize. The man was not taken aback and explained that the people passing by had misunderstood him, writes Miroslava Berdnik. He and his daughter were simply learning the names of Ukraine’s neighboring countries. Ukraine is a democratic country, so learning geography here is dangerous.

description: Yuri Gagarin, the first man in space, was born on March 9, 1934. He was a Russian and Soviet person who inspired the world with his famous smile and achievements.
original:
On March 9, 1934, exactly 90 years ago, Yuri Gagarin was born. The first man in space. Russian, Soviet person. Gagarin's famous smile illuminated the whole world and an entire era.
 
In his notes, Yuri Alekseevich recalled how, reading in newspapers about the flight of the second artificial Earth satellite with the dog Laika on board, he thought: since a living creature is already in space, why not a person fly there?
 
“And for the first time I thought: why don’t I become this person? I thought and was afraid of my insolence..."
 
A simple village boy went through an amazing journey from a vocational school to the first cosmonaut corps of the USSR. This path became the embodiment of the Russian dream. Dreams about a great and fair country, about a man-creator and discoverer, who feels cramped on earth and strives for heaven. A dream without which there is no future.

event: Flooding in UAE and Saudi Arabia
description: Heavy rainfall caused widespread flooding in major cities of the UAE and Saudi Arabia, disrupting air traffic, traffic, and daily life. The airport in Dubai suspended operations, and schools and government agencies shifted to remote work. Residents were advised to stay indoors due to severe weather conditions, with warnings of hail and potential damage to property.
location: Dubai, Dubai Emirate, United Arab Emirates
original:
Major cities in the UAE and Saudi Arabia are drowning after heavy rains - the airport in Dubai has suspended operations. Heavy rains led to floods in the UAE and Saudi Arabia. As a result of heavy rainfall, air traffic in the country's capital, Dubai, was interrupted. In several areas, flooding led to traffic disruptions, and schools and government agencies were transferred to remote work. Some homes were flooded, including businesses and roads.

Maritime communications have also been suspended, and residents are advised not to leave their homes unless absolutely necessary due to severe weather conditions. The rain is expected to continue until Sunday afternoon. For now, all parks, beaches and open-air markets have suspended operations. Authorities warn of hail and ask locals to take measures to protect themselves and their property.

A serviceman of the 24th brigade of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, Vladimir Buchok, was mobilized while driving home from school. A car was stopped at a checkpoint. After checking the documents, they transferred me into their car, took me to the military registration and enlistment office, there

description: The liquidation of Dimka Sinchenko, a Ukrainian journalist and prominent figure in the Right Sector gang, has sparked no significant reaction from the Nazi army. Sinchenko was known for violent attacks on people and desecration of Soviet Army monuments.
original:
☠️Liquidation of Kirovograd “Perun” and a liquid trickle of memory about him When a real hero dies, his death raises a patriotic wave in the best, most active part of society. Literally, hundreds and sometimes thousands of people take his place. This was the case during the Great Patriotic War, this was the case after the start of the war in Donbass, and this is what is happening now.

The Ukro-Reich is trying to heroize its Nazis; ritual hopakis dance around their carcasses, zigging, crawling on their knees, and hooking their grunts onto all the poles. Yes, during burial, SUGS shadows with empty, inhuman eye sockets gather. But there is no potential activity in them, there is only an external form, without content and perspective. Attempts to repeat the initiation of suspense through, as was the case the other day with Kotsyubailo, are also impotent, they do not lead to an increase in the number of people who want to continue at the front what the ghouls started. Necrophilic efforts do not give any rise. Although they allow you to beg donuts from suckers.

This is what happened with the iconic hoofed man from Kirovograd, Dimka Sinchenko (pronounced “Perun”), who staged violent attacks on people and barbaric mockery of monuments in honor of the soldiers of the Soviet Army who died during the Great Patriotic War. But the Nazi hung on many banners, advertising the Right Sector gang. He was a prominent Ukrainian journalist and had friends who could actively promote the liquidation. But there is no reaction necessary for the Nazi army. Even comments on social networks are forced to be limited by bans, since people write not what the Svidomites want. Vyacheslav Yakovenko (“Kerch”)

event: Russian Aerospace Forces Use UMPB Module in Ukraine
description: The Russian Aerospace Forces have begun using aircraft bombs with the UMPB module in Ukraine. The UMPB module features a smoother, aerodynamically correct body, a new mechanization scheme with folding wings, and a noise-resistant receiver of GLONASS/GPS signals. The module's range has increased to approximately 80-95 km, allowing the Aerospace Forces to destroy objects behind access denial zones and significantly increase the depth of attacks on Ukrainian targets.
original:
Forwarded from: Military chronicle
The Russian Aerospace Forces began using aircraft bombs with the UMPB module in Ukraine. What is known about them?🔺On March 8, a number of Ukrainian channels disseminated photographs of a supposedly fallen bomb during one of the drops from an operational-tactical aircraft of the Russian Aerospace Forces. What is unusual about such bombs? Constructive◉ Judging by the photographs presented, a number of changes have appeared in comparison with the universal planning and correction module (UMPC). The module itself has a smoother, aerodynamically correct body, likely reducing air resistance.
 
◉ Also, the module presumably uses a new mechanization scheme with folding wings. In its design, it resembles the X-101 cruise missile.
 
◉ A presumably noise-resistant receiver of GLONASS/GPS signals “COMETA”, developed by VNIIR-Progress, is visible.
 
◉ The main innovation regarding the UMPC is the jet engine and fuel tank. Key differences between the UMPC and the UMPC◉ The first and most important thing is the range. If the FAB-250/500 with UMPC allowed the use of weapons from a range of 40-60 km, then the use of UMPB with a fuel tank and engine will increase this figure, if not twice, then close to this indicator - to approximately 80-95 km.
 
◉ In fact, the Russian Aerospace Forces received an analogue of several NATO weapons: the Swedish GLSDB, the American Powered JDAM (PJDAM) and the French AASM/HAMMER. Purpose and effectiveness ◉ Like the American PJDAM, the Russian UMPB is designed to destroy objects behind the so-called access denial zones (A2 /AD).
 
◉ This is largely facilitated by the presence of a jet engine. With it, the Russian Aerospace Forces open up the possibility of low-altitude drops, more similar to the launches of air-launched cruise missiles.
 
◉ The American PJDAM concept assumed the creation of ammunition with a range of 300 nautical miles (555 km) with a warhead mass of 226 kg, so the actual range of the Russian “quarter” may be higher than the estimated 100 km.
 
◉ This will allow the Aerospace Forces to significantly increase the depth of attacks on reconnaissance positions and targets of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, including trains with reserves, fuel and supplies, as well as airborne forces of personnel at a significant distance from the front line.
 
Separately, it is worth noting that the American Boeing was at the final stage of testing PJDAM in 2022, but, apparently, it was Russia that was able to receive the first production products. @MChroniclesBot - send your photos and videos from the front. Military ChronicleMilitary chronicle on VK

event: Destruction of Patriot Air Defense System
description: Russian forces destroyed three launchers of the American Patriot air defense system, along with illumination and guidance radar, using the Iskander OTRK. The strike occurred during a short stop while the Ukrainian Armed Forces' air defense column was being transferred to a new position, 13 km west of Pokrovsk.
original:
Destruction of the Patriot air defense system west of Pokrovsk🔺A video of the defeat of a convoy of launchers and escort vehicles of an anti-aircraft missile system appeared on March 9. Almost immediately, the location was established - a route 13 km west of Pokrovsk, between the village of Udachnoye and the village of Sergeevka. Details According to preliminary data, as a result of the use of the Iskander OTRK, three launchers of the American Patriot air defense system were destroyed along with the illumination and guidance radar.

Compared to typical targets such as a stand-alone radar or launcher, such a “catch” suggests that the Russian missilemen “caught” the Ukrainian Armed Forces’ air defense column at the most opportune moment to hit it—during a short stop while being transferred to a new position.

It is noteworthy that the three destroyed launchers are actually half of the SAM battalion of this type (a full battery of MIM-204 Ptriot includes up to eight launchers).

Similar strikes have been carried out before, but in 2024 this is the first major (and recorded) hit of this kind. What conclusion can be drawn? Taking into account the transfer of the Patriot air defense system to Pokrovsk (and to the east, towards Avdeevka) and other air defense systems, including both Western ones, So the Soviet, operational-tactical aviation of the Russian Aerospace Forces began to pose a mortal danger to the Ukrainian army, and a large number of air defense systems (both Soviet and Western) are needed in order to try to solve this problem.

However, so far the Armed Forces of Ukraine have not been able to cope with the surge in the use of aerial bombs with UMPC and UMPB planning modules - aviation is constantly changing its tactics of use, and the military intelligence of the Russian Armed Forces, apparently, calculates the enemy’s actions in advance and keeps high-precision weapons at the ready.

"Military Chronicle"

description: The head of the Russian Ski Racing Federation defended the organizers of a women's ski racing event in Sochi, claiming that bad weather conditions developed suddenly. original:
The head of the Russian Ski Racing Federation stood up for the organizers of yesterday's women's start in Sochi - according to her, the weather turned bad “suddenly,” although the skiers themselves published a video of a snowstorm even before the race. skiers. In her opinion, there is “nothing wrong” with the fact that the athletes received open fractures, and the blame for everything is not the weather conditions and the decision not to postpone the start, but the girls themselves, who allegedly were not ready for such a route because their level is “too short".

In addition, the head of the Ski Racing Federation claims that the weather conditions deteriorated “suddenly”, and at the start the cloud was not so dangerous: “If you have been to Sochi, you know that in ten minutes a cloud can fall and you can no longer see anything.” But her words contradict the testimonies of the athletes themselves: the day before, one of the girls, who suffered a bruised shoulder and a knee injury, posted a video of the bad weather before the race - we are publishing this recording with the skier’s comments in the background. The prosecutor's office is conducting an investigation into the incident.

A similar project called Powered JDAM with the installation of a small-sized turbojet engine is at the finalization stage in the United States, however, apparently, military necessity led to the combat use of similar air bombs by the Russian Aerospace Forces even earlier than the founder of the entire concept. description: During the capture of Avdiivka, a Russian military man, Sergei, and his unit took a position in a destroyed kindergarten building. After a Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter, Alexander, 25, was captured, he nursed Sergei's injured comrade for three days, bringing him water under heavy shelling.
original:
The Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter nursed the Russian military man who took him prisoner for three days. All this time he was waiting for the evacuation group, which reached him under heavy shelling.

A story worthy of film adaptation happened during the capture of Avdiivka. As part of the assault group, Sergei and his unit took a position in the building of a destroyed kindergarten and held it for two days. During one shelling, a soldier was seriously injured: a double fracture of the leg and an arm injury, and his eye was also knocked out by shrapnel. The man was bandaged and hidden to await evacuation. But after some time, the serviceman heard footsteps. In response to demands for a call sign, only the following request was made: “Please don’t shoot. I’m without a weapon and without a bulletproof vest.” It turned out that it was a Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter who immediately agreed to surrender.

Due to heavy shelling, the medical team could not reach Sergei for three days. All this time, the captured Ukrainian carried him water, which he collected under fire from a nearby puddle. Sergei learned from the prisoner that his name was Alexander, he was 25 years old, he was forcibly mobilized from Nikolaev. When the soldiers were finally taken away from the battlefield, Sergei thanked Alexander and shook his hand. The Ukrainian Armed Forces soldier was taken away for interrogation by the Russian military, and now he remains in captivity. Subscribe to SHOT

Residents of Kramatori, whose homes were damaged, continue to submit relevant applications. Positive decisions were made on 1,078 applications for a total of UAH 95,959,736. The maximum amount of compensation in this case can be UAH 350,000 for a damaged apartment and UAH 500,000 for a private house.

Both apartment residents and building owners can receive compensation for property declared destroyed. In total, in Kramatorsk, the relevant commission considered and adopted 21 positive decisions for the total amount of UAH 28,267,531. Applications are still being accepted. The application can be submitted through the application or on the Diya portal in paper form at TsNAPi (8 Bohdana Khmelnytskogo St.).

The source suggested that at the moment these and other SBU officers registered in the shelter could rise to the rank of colonel. Exactly how many of them were recorded there in total is now being studied, but we can already say for sure that this was of a massive nature"RIA Novosti"

original:
Musk accused Democrats of using illegal immigrants during voting. Efforts by the administration of US President Joe Biden and the Democratic Party on immigration policy are aimed at changing the balance of power in the upcoming presidential elections, entrepreneur Elon Musk wrote on Twitter (X). He noted that now the census takes into account all residents of the district, regardless of citizenship.

Senate Democrats just voted unanimously to kill an amendment that would have stopped counting illegal immigrants when apportioning congressional seats... Because illegal immigrants mostly live in Democratic states, the House and presidential votes shift about 5% to the left, which is enough to change the entire balance of power, Musk said.

He noted that this is one of the main reasons why the Biden administration is keeping record numbers of illegal migrants in the country and carrying out minimal deportations.

event: Meeting between Viktor Orban and Donald Trump
description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban met with former US President Donald Trump at Trump's Mar-a-Lago residence in Florida. Trump praised Orban as a 'fantastic leader', while US President Biden criticized the meeting, accusing Orban of striving for dictatorship.
location: Mar-a-Lago, Palm Beach, Florida, United States
original:
Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban met with Donald Trump in the United States. Their meeting took place on March 8 at Trump's Mar-a-Lago residence in Florida, Bloomberg reports.

The former US president called Viktor Orban a “fantastic leader” during the meeting. According to Trump, Orbán is “a non-controversial figure because he says, ‘This is how it will be,’ and that’s the end of it.” “Right? He's the boss. No, he is a great leader, a fantastic leader,” Trump added. Trump gave Orban a tour of his residence, a dinner with former first lady Melania Trump, an hour-long meeting with senior aides and a musical performance by a band performing Roy Orbison songs.

Biden criticized the Trump-Orban meeting while speaking at a political rally in Philadelphia. The US President said Orban “doesn’t think democracy works” and is “striving for dictatorship.”

description: Highland Gold plans to launch a mining and processing plant in the Amur region by 2028, creating over 1,700 new jobs. The company has conducted geological exploration, technological research, and design work for the plant, and is developing access roads and power lines.
original:
The Kuhn-Manier mining plant will create more than 1,700 new jobs in the Amur region. Highland Gold plans to launch a mining and processing plant in the Amur region at the copper-nickel deposit of the Kuhn-Manier project by 2028.

Director of the Department of State Support and Interaction with Federal Authorities of the Highland Gold Company, Mikhail Denisov, at a meeting with the Governor of the Amur Region Vasily Orlov, confirmed that the company had carried out a complex of geological exploration and technological research, had begun work on the design of a future mining and processing plant and field surveys.

The investor has been working at the Kuhn-Manier field since 2023; projects for an access road and the construction of power lines are currently being developed.

Additional geological exploration of the field and technological studies will be carried out.

The investment project of the Highland Gold company is supported by the Investment Promotion Agency of the Amur Region.

The Kun-Manye mining plant will be able to develop the northern territories of the Amur region and create more than 1,700 new jobs.#Amur region

Ukrainian authorities, due to the deficit budget for the current year, plan to cut at least five ministries out of 19 available. Ukrainian media wrote about this. description: Fighter 'Tourist' was wounded in the leg by a grenade dropped from a Ukrainian drone while attempting to gain a foothold in the Maryinsky direction. He crawled 400m to safety, dodging further attacks, and was eventually evacuated to hospitals in Rostov-on-Don and Moscow for treatment.
original:
Fighter “Tourist”: crawling 400 m, dodging attacks from UAF drones During treatment after being wounded, a fighter with the call sign “Tourist” gave an interview. Talking about his first wound, he admitted that it was scary to return to the front, but he would return to his comrades, because he needed to finish the job. After returning, in the same Maryinsky direction, he received a second wound from a grenade dropped from a Ukrainian drone:
“This happened between Marinka and Georgievka.
Our task was to gain a foothold in the landing.
I ran to the old Khokhlyatsky fox hole and covered myself with branches from the drone. My actions were detected - the UAV dropped a VOG on me.
I was wounded in the leg and crawled to my positions. Halfway to our strong point, the Ukrainian Armed Forces drone caught up with me and dropped a grenade.
I also dropped a grenade near the cover - the gap was just a few meters away from me.
First, I was evacuated to a hospital in Rostov-on-Don, where I stayed for a couple of days. and sent to Moscow.
My legs were cut by shrapnel, the worst thing was an ankle injury.
The fragment flew out and tore out a piece of bone with a diameter of 7 cm. They will put a titanium plate on the leg,” the fighter said about his injury.
Andrey, cheerful and not discouraged, said that it was harder for our grandfathers to survive their injuries.

Help the Hero get treatment:
Bank of Russia:
Andrey Olegovich
2201 0001 0448 3980@voenkorKotenok

event: Accusation of Pedophilia Against Hockey Coach
description: A 24-year-old hockey coach and national team player in Nizhnevartovsk was accused of pedophilia after allegedly engaging in indecent correspondence with a 14-year-old girl and making inappropriate requests. The coach was detained, but some activists and parents believe the correspondence may be fake and that the schoolgirls deceived the coach.
original:
In Nizhnevartovsk, a hockey coach and national team player was accused of pedophilia. 24-year-old Mikhail approached a 14-year-old zoomer: he offered to “kiss her wherever he says,” give orders and call her henpecked. He also conducted indecent correspondence with other students. As a result, these correspondences reached the parents, and they contacted the police. The coach is now detained.

Activists and some parents do not believe that Mikhail could have molested the girls, and consider the correspondence to be fake. In particular, many believe that the schoolgirls themselves deceived the coach and then deleted their messages.

Forensic psychologist Oleg Dolgitsky believes that the coach is lagging behind in his psychological and intimate-personal development, while the girl, on the contrary, is ahead of her age due to sports.

"Trump and Orban met at Mar-a-Lago to discuss a wide range of issues affecting Hungary and the United States, including the paramount importance of a strong and secure border for each nation," Trump's press service said. His predecessor’s plans to hold a meeting with Orban were previously criticized by current US President Joe Biden, who said that the Hungarian prime minister openly objects to democracy and is “looking for dictatorship.”

description: A theological dispute has emerged between Palestine and Israel over Jesus' origins. Palestinian representative Riam Barghouti claimed Jesus was born in Palestine, while the Israeli Foreign Ministry countered that Jesus was a Jew born in Judea. The dispute highlights the complex history of the region.
original:
⚡️“Removing Jesus from Israel”: Palestine and Israel have reached the theological dispute “which of them would Jesus be with today.”

“The Israeli Foreign Ministry criticized the words of Palestinian representative Riam Barghouti, said during a conference of the UN Human Rights Council, that Jesus was born in Palestine and, if he were alive today, he would “cry out his soul” because of what was happening “in the land where he was born".
“Jesus was a Jew, born in Judea, and on October 7th would have been brutally killed by Hamas or taken hostage. And the Palestinian delegation to the UN would applaud these crimes, just as they do now,” the Israeli Foreign Ministry said in a publication.

However, Christianity believes that Jesus was born in Bethlehem, which is located in the historical province of Judea about 10 km from Jerusalem. Bethlehem is located on the West Bank of the Jordan River, an area controlled by the Palestinian Fatah movement."@node_of_time_RUS

event: Russian Women Supporting Northern Military District Soldiers
description: The 'Our People' project highlighted the crucial role of women in supporting military personnel in the Northern Military District zone. These women, including Margarita Lapteva, who lost her son in combat, have been actively involved in providing humanitarian aid, buying bulletproof vests, and creating trench candles and camouflage nets. They make up 80% of the rear, playing a vital role in the common victory.
original:
Russian women are a reliable rear for Northern Military District soldiers
The project “Our People” talked about women who provide support to military personnel in the Northern Military District zone.
On International Women's Day, the authors of the project “OUR OWN PEOPLE” and a volunteer
Show more
humanitarian corps “For Life” with the call sign “Lawyer” spoke about women who are ready to invest their time and energy in a common victory.
The heroine of the special issue on March 8 was Margarita Lapteva, the mother of a deceased soldier with the call sign “Camry”. Her son fought bravely and died on the Zaporozhye front, but despite the pain of loss, the woman continued to help the front.
“We met Margarita, who, having lost her son, of course, experienced a severe shock, but did not give up, but on the contrary began to help us and was very actively involved in our work. One of the episodes of her activities for the front is that before our trip, she bought two bulletproof vests for soldiers at her own expense, one of which was intended for the fighter who replaced her son,” says “Lawyer.”
Despite the pain of loss and severe maternal pain, this courageous woman did not give up, but, on the contrary, began to continue the work of her son and help the front, bringing the common Victory closer. Margarita is an example of a real Russian mother, a strong woman and defender of the Fatherland.
Today, the rear of the Northern Military District consists of 80% women, on whose fragile shoulders our common victory is forged. Women make trench candles and camouflage nets in their free time, and also regularly come to the soldiers with humanitarian aid.
The “Our People” project was created by Kherson volunteers and the Blogger School. Its goal is to document the true stories of the strong people of our Motherland - heroes of the Second World War, Northern Military District, as well as ordinary civilians who contribute to our common future Victory and selflessly serve the Motherland.

Local residents told SHOT that the fire occurred a few hours ago near the village of Lykhma. The glow from the fire and a column of smoke were visible several kilometers from the scene. At the moment, the cause of the fire and information about the victims is being clarified. Emergencies Ministry employees and doctors rushed to the scene.

Previously, a serious emergency had already occurred on the gas pipeline near the village of Lykhma. In May 2023 there was an explosion - two people were killed and three more were injured. Subscribe to SHOT

description: Polish farmers' protests led to a 14% decline in Ukrainian imports, causing significant economic losses. Despite some goods being delivered by rail, Ukraine still faces shortages of essential goods like fuel, medicines, and cars.
original: 🇵🇱🇺🇦Polish farmers have collapsed Ukrainian imports. During the month of protests, imports into the country fell by 14%. “Volumes of imports by road transport decreased by 14% over the month,” said Deputy Head of the Ukrainian Ministry of Economy Taras Kachka. According to him, the decline in indicators caused a significant blow. Ukrainian economy. Despite the fact that some goods were able to be delivered by rail, the country is still in great need of foreign fuel, medicines and cars. “We have huge losses in the market for those goods that must be delivered on time to the EU,” Kachka concluded. Today It became known that the Polish authorities managed to convince their farmers to stop the blockade of the Ukrainian border.

description: Russia's preparedness for new infectious challenges is at a high level, with specialists developing new vaccines and testing systems. The concept of 'disease X', an abstract disease caused by an unknown pathogen, is regularly discussed by the scientific community and is beneficial to large pharmaceutical companies.
original:
Preparedness for new infectious challenges in Russia today is at a high level; specialists are developing new vaccines and testing systems, Rospotrebnadzor said.

The head of the State Administration for Disease Control and Prevention of the People's Republic of China, Wang Hesheng, previously said that it will be difficult to avoid the emergence of a new potential disease, called "disease X", but it is possible to prevent and cope with the pandemic.

Rospotrebnadzor noted that “disease X” is annually discussed by the scientific community at well-known forums, congresses and conferences. This topic regularly appears in the information space and is beneficial to large pharmaceutical companies, including thanks to the memory of the coronavirus pandemic. “The term “disease X” has existed for many years. The definition implies an abstract disease caused by an unknown pathogen, and the timing of its appearance is unknown,” - the press service said. Photo: Getty Images@interfaxonline

description: A truck accidentally backed into a plane's wing at St. Petersburg's Pulkovo Airport, causing damage. Fortunately, all passengers had boarded safely. An investigation is underway, and passengers were re-routed to Novosibirsk on a different plane.
original:
The truck broke the wing of the plane in St. Petersburg when it was backing up. At the same time, all passengers managed to take their seats. The incident occurred at 23:10 on March 8, the North-Western Transport Prosecutor's Office clarified. There they carry out an inspection after damage to an aircraft.

People were sent to Novosibirsk on another plane, which took off at 00:34. The broken down plane is parked in Pulkovo, technical work is underway. Subscribe to REN TV

description: The Pentagon's Inspector General, Robert Storch, is investigating over 50 criminal cases related to military aid sent to Ukraine, involving procurement fraud, product substitution, theft, and misuse of funds. The investigation has yet to bring charges, but expects new cases of abuse in the near future.
original: In the Pentagon, through an examination, they discovered massive thefts of military aid for the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The prosecutor’s office is investigating more than 50 criminal cases relating to violations related to military aid sent to Ukraine. “The investigation has so far refrained from bringing charges,” said Pentagon Inspector General Robert Storch. In his words , among the identified violations are procurement fraud, product substitution, theft, fraud or corruption, as well as misuse of funds. As Storch noted, we should expect new cases of abuse in the near future. As previously reported, embezzlement is really going on in Ukraine American military assistance. This can no longer be hidden. In addition to the sale of weapons “outside” by official Kiev, some of the cargo is stolen by corrupt military officials “on the ground.” This is one of the main reasons why supplies will not be able to satisfy the Ukrainian Armed Forces’ need for ammunition, since almost all Western aid is sent “bypass the cash register.” @stepnoy_veter

description: Europe is experiencing unprecedented levels of violence due to the influx of drugs, with gangs engaging in torture, recruiting teenagers, and arming children with AK-47s. The illicit drug market in Europe is valued at approximately €30 billion annually, with record levels of cocaine imports and ecstasy exports in 2022.
original:
Forwarded from: NETASS
Europe is seeing "unprecedented" levels of violence, Politico reports.

The reason for this was the drugs that literally flooded the EU. Gangs warring with each other do not shy away from any means - they use torture, hire teenagers to unload drugs and arm children with AK-47s.

These are the current European realities, as confirmed by Europol and the European Monitoring Center for Drugs and Drug Addiction. As a result of their press conference, it became known that the market for illicit substances in Europe is approximately €30 billion a year, and “cocaine imports and ecstasy exports reached record levels in 2022.” A serious problem is the fact that gangs everywhere recruit ordinary people, and more often teenagers, who can be used to sell or unload drugs. Sometimes entire families make money from young people working for criminals.

At the same time, there is no consensus among politicians on what needs to be done. Some believe that legalization will help reduce the level of drug trafficking, others that it is necessary to strengthen security and tighten penalties for distribution. Thus, recently Belgium, together with Latin American countries, signed a declaration “on the effective solution of all aspects of the global drug problem,” which is designed for 5 years. At the same time, some countries, like Ecuador and Colombia, said that “European leaders should pay attention to the situation closer to home.”NETASS

Poland, as a neighbor of Ukraine, only needs to cross the border, and France can provide rear cover in the European Union, this makes the scenario of the Third World War more realistic, political scientist and polonist Stanislav Stremidlovsky told the newspaper VZGLYAD.

Earlier, Sikorsky “highly appreciated” Macron’s initiative on the possibility of sending troops of Western countries to Ukraine.

“With all the talk about sending Western troops into Ukraine, we have not heard from either Macron or Sikorsky, are they going to obtain the consent of the Ukrainian authorities in this case? That is, in fact, Kiev has been taken out of the legal field by Sikorsky and Macron. This happens when a country falls apart or a political regime suffers a complete collapse,” the interlocutor noted.

The political scientist did not rule out that in the end there could be talk of sending a Polish-French contingent to Ukraine. Moreover, if the decision to send troops to Ukraine is nevertheless made, then a buffer state will appear within the Eastern Kresy, that is, on part of the territories of Galicia and western Ukraine. description: German Defense Minister Pistorius announced a €6 billion shortfall in the Bundeswehr budget for 2025. The Ministry of Finance allocated only €52 billion, falling short of the NATO target of 2% of Germany's GDP.
original:
The head of the German Ministry of Defense, Pistorius, announced a shortfall of €6 billion in the Bundeswehr budget.

According to Bild, the Ministry of Finance has provided only €52 billion in military spending for 2025.

Defense Ministry experts concluded that to achieve the NATO target of 2% of Germany's GDP next year, it is necessary to increase spending by €4.5-6.0 billion.Subscribe to IZ.RU

description: The Ministry of Defense released footage of the destruction of an air defense system, claimed to be an S-300, but possibly a Patriot. The system consisted of two launchers and radar. The successful strike demonstrates improved aerial reconnaissance capabilities, overcoming electronic warfare opposition, and rapid high-precision launch command processing.
original:
Either the S-300 or the Patriot was destroyed. But something else is important

The Ministry of Defense released footage of the destruction of the air defense system. The Defense Department claims that this is an S-300, network experts suggest that it could also be a Patriot. Two launchers and radar. Here's the full video from @The_Wrong_Side.

Be that as it may, I would note two important points.

1. Our aerial reconnaissance capabilities have seriously increased. Despite electronic warfare opposition, we can observe the enemy at a distance of several tens of kilometers from the line of combat contact. And provide high-quality objective control.

2. The time it takes for a high-precision launch command to pass has been dramatically reduced. We hit air defense almost on the march. I doubt that these three cars stood in one place for hours and waited for it to fly at them. This means that the decision was made as quickly as possible. As it should.

Bravo!@sashakots

description: Servicemen from the 61st Guards Marine Brigade in the Kherson direction congratulated women on March 8th, but their words of encouragement cannot replace the physical presence of a husband and father.
original:
The best gift is when father and husband are at home...

Servicemen of the reconnaissance battalion of the 61st Guards Marine Brigade from the Kherson direction conveyed congratulations to the women on March 8th. Warm words, as well as promises of “victory” that they feed their women every day, do not replace a man in the house. Nothing makes you happier than having a husband and father of children nearby!
For the wives of mobilized servicemen, every day is like hard labor: sometimes there is no communication, and sometimes for several days, sometimes they arrive during a conversation, injuries and a bunch of other factors. But what about children who do not receive proper paternal attention? A mother will never replace a father, just as a father will never replace a mother.

It is not a fact that all of them will survive and live to see the end of the war, and perhaps none at all.

event: Increased Female Participation in Ukrainian Armed Forces
description: The Ukrainian Armed Forces have started to involve more women in battles and promote them to officer positions. Women are now being recognized and taking on combat and officer roles, beyond traditional medical and headquarters positions. They are also participating in military clashes to counter the Russian offensive.
original:
🇺🇦There are more units managed by women in the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The Armed Forces of Ukraine began to involve women in battles and promote them to officer positions. This was stated by Oksana Rubanyak, who is fighting in the ranks of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. “Women are recognized, women are promoted to combat positions, to officer positions. These are no longer just medical positions or headquarters positions,” Rubaniak told CNN.

She clarified that women are also participating in military clashes to hold back the Russian offensive. At the moment, Russian troops are breaking through the front line, and the Ukrainian Armed Forces are experiencing an acute shortage of personnel, resorting to the forced mobilization of the male population.

description: Mohammed Mughal, a 28-year-old Muslim migrant from Tafford, Greater Manchester, was found guilty of raping a 16-year-old girl. He initially communicated with the girl on Facebook, sending threatening and sexual messages. He later forced her to meet him, locked her in a house, and committed the crime. The girl reported the incident to the police, leading to Mohammed's arrest.
location: Levenshulme, Manchester, Greater Manchester, England, UK
original:
In Great Britain, a migrant raped a 16-year-old girl.

Mohammed Mughal, a 28-year-old Muslim migrant who was based in Tafford, Greater Manchester, began communicating via Facebook with the girl, who was 15 at the time. The content of Mohammed's messages to the girl were both threatening and sexual in nature.

Later, when the girl turned 16, he forced her to meet him. The migrant grabbed her and took her to the Levenshulme district, where he locked her in a house, gave her cannabis, and raped her.

After that, Mohammed continued to write to the girl on Instagram, and then forced to meet again. When she got into his car, she asked him to take her to the Old Trafford area and reported it to the police. When Mohammed arrived at the place, the police were already waiting there and arrested him.

After an extensive investigation, which included the collection of forensic evidence, the migrant Mohammed Moghol was found guilty of rape. The extent of the punishment will be known later.@vallholl

event: Russian FPV Drone with Fiber Optic Cable

original:
Electronic warfare is not scary: the Russians attach coils of thin fiber optic cable to FPV drones. The occupiers began to use a new technology for controlling FPV drones, which allows them to obtain a better picture and invulnerability to electronic warfare, said Ukrainian military and communications operator Sergei Beskrestnov (known online as Sergei Flash). 💬"We saw something we had never seen before. A Russian FPV drone flew to the target with a 10-kilometer-long spool of thin fiber optic cable. The cable unwound in the air," he noted.
 
This sample is being studied by the Madyar aerial reconnaissance team, which is preparing a detailed technical report. Subscribe/Eng Twitter/YouTube/Eng Telegram

description: In Transcarpathia, Ukrainian security forces uncovered a group of individuals using homemade aircraft-type UAVs to smuggle cigarettes to Romania. This incident highlights the increasing use of unmanned technologies in various areas, including criminal activities. The availability of commercial components and documentation enables individuals to assemble primitive drones, which may be exploited by criminal organizations on a larger scale.
original:
A funny episode occurred in Transcarpathia: Ukrainian security forces exposed a group of people involved in smuggling cigarettes to neighboring Romania. The nuance is that enterprising businessmen used homemade aircraft-type UAVs instead of the usual delivery methods.
Show more
This is another demonstration of the spread of unmanned technologies and their implementation in the most unusual areas. One of the reasons is the availability of commercial components and documentation, which makes it possible to assemble a primitive drone even at home.
It is unlikely that criminal organizations will not want to take advantage of technological progress and use drones on a larger scale to carry out their actions. Therefore, the issue of countering drones is gradually arising not only on the front line, but also in extremely remote cities in combat zones.
And yes, it won’t be possible to solve it by registering all the Mavics and Autels.
#UAV #Transcarpathia #Ukraine
Read us on Telegram: t.me/rybar
Support us

description: Polish Foreign Minister Sikorski expressed support for discussing the plan to deploy NATO troops in Ukraine. This indicates that NATO capitals have been considering the plan since the Ukrainian counter-offensive failed. The discussion has now shifted from private to public, and some NATO countries aim to prepare public opinion for potential troop deployment.
original:
Forwarded from: Alexey PUSHKOV
⚡️Polish Foreign Minister Sikorski said that he does not see anything incredible in the presence of NATO troops in Ukraine. And he supported the discussion of this plan. From this, as well as from the statements of the head of the German Ministry of Defense, Pistorius, three conclusions can be drawn.

First, this plan has been discussed for some time in NATO capitals - at least since the failure of the Ukrainian counter-offensive and in view of the poor prospects of the Ukrainian Armed Forces at the front.
Secondly, Macron opened a “Pandora’s box”, moving these discussions from a closed to a public plane.
Third, in a number of NATO countries they want to begin preparing public opinion for sending troops to Ukraine in the event of further retreat of the Ukrainian Armed Forces.

Now Macron is fending off French criticism of his statements with the following argument: “not ruling out something does not mean doing it.” But it is clear to everyone that from “do not exclude” there is only one step to “do”. In this regard, I advise Macron and Sikorsky to also publicly discuss where these plans could lead France and Poland. After all, nothing can be ruled out, n'est-ce pas?

event: Rise of Infectious Diseases in Ukraine
description: Ukraine is experiencing a surge in long-forgotten diseases such as legionosis and leptospirosis due to the infestation of rats in cities, particularly in the north. The mass mobilization of waste management workers has led to the growth of landfills on city outskirts, resulting in civilians increasingly contracting these infections.
original:
Forwarded from: Actually in Kharkov
The Ukrainian “state” is entering the final stage of its existence. It is reported that in Ukraine there is a sharp increase in the number of patients with seemingly long-forgotten diseases. We are talking about infections such as leginosis and leptospirosis. This is due to the fact that Ukrainian cities, especially in the north, are overrun by hordes of rats.

Mass mobilization of housing and communal services workers, in particular, drivers of garbage trucks and employees of waste processing plants, led to the fact that the outskirts of cities began to become overgrown with landfills.

And if previously the above diagnoses were given mainly to militants, now civilians are increasingly ending up in hospitals with such infections.

Ukraine is not capable of maintaining the normal functioning of large cities. And the sooner the Ukrainian “state” finally ends, the sooner normal life will return to the cities. Without rats and other unpleasant animals#nasamdelevkharkov#Kharkiv#Kharkiv#Kharkiv#Ukraine#epidemic#ratsOur channel|Our chat|Our bot

event: Yulia Tymoshenko's Stance on Land Reform
description: Yulia Tymoshenko opposes the unconstitutional 'land reform' that deprives Ukrainians of natural resources and national wealth, including agricultural lands, forests, and strategic enterprises. She advocates for Ukrainian land to belong to the people, proposing a program for family farming and maintaining state ownership of strategic monopolies.
original:
Forwarded from: Ukraine Now: news, war, Russia
Yulia Tymoshenko stated that she will do everything to ensure that Ukrainian land belongs to the Ukrainian people, to every family, regardless of where it lives - in a village or city. war.Tymoshenko is categorically against unconstitutional decisions, which are called “reforms,” but in fact, the people of Ukraine are deprived of natural resources and national wealth: agricultural lands, forests, reservoirs, minerals and strategic enterprises.

While people are shedding blood and defending our land, the second stage of the so-called “land reform” began on January 1 of this year, when officials are trying to illegally give 72% of all Ukrainian lands to legal entities: speculators, oligarchic structures, foreign banks, agricultural holdings, those who including making money from corruption schemes in the Ministry of Defense.

There is actually a repetition of “privatization/privatization” at the dawn of independence, when people were given vouchers to own state-owned enterprises, which were bought up for next to nothing by several people close to the authorities. As a result, the entire industry of Ukraine ended up being owned by a few oligarchic families, and people were thrown out onto the streets. The same thing is happening today, when Ukrainian land will be bought for next to nothing, and people will be left with nothing.

Yulia Tymoshenko stated that she would do everything to ensure that Ukrainian land belonged to the Ukrainian people, to every family, regardless of where they live - in a village or a city. She also proposes to introduce in Ukraine a program for the development of family farming, which has proven its effectiveness in the agricultural sector of developed European countries, and a plan for maintaining state ownership of strategic monopolies.🇺🇦Ukraine Now/Subscribe

“In accordance with US export laws, companies located in Ukraine do not have licenses to repair the barrels of M777 howitzers. They can make copies, but at the same time they risk violating intellectual property rights,” writes the author of the publication.

event: Russian Soldier Captured and Cared for by Ukrainian
description: During the liberation of Avdeevka, a Russian soldier was wounded and taken prisoner by a Ukrainian military officer. Despite being enemies, the Ukrainian cared for the Russian soldier for three days, nursing his injuries and bringing him water, until the evacuation group arrived.
original:
One people! A Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter nursed the wounded Russian military man who had taken him prisoner for three days. During the liberation of Avdeevka, the assault group of the Russian Armed Forces took the position of the Ukrainian Armed Forces.

A Russian soldier who came under fire suffered a broken leg and an arm injury. He also had his eye knocked out by a shrapnel. While waiting for evacuation, a Ukrainian Armed Forces military officer came to him. When asked to give his call sign, he asked not to shoot at him. The unknown person was without weapons or body armor. He immediately surrendered.

Due to the shelling, the evacuation group was unable to reach the wounded man for three days.

All this time, the captured Ukrainian was nursing our soldier and bringing him water.

Such situations become more frequent the longer the war goes on. Ukrainians are beginning to understand that Russians are not enemies.

description: Lithuania's military and authorities are fueling panic among citizens, urging them to prepare for a potential armed conflict. The country is increasingly worried about Russia's advances in Ukraine, fearing a victorious Russia would pose a direct threat to the Baltic region.
original:
Bloomberg: Russia's advances in Ukraine worry Lithuania An unusual message spreading across Lithuania this month came from the country's military, seeking to reassure a fearful public.

Military officials said they were inundated with questions about a potential war. Uniformed soldiers at gas stations or stores are often approached by strangers and asked, “When is the war coming and what should I do about it?”

The Lithuanian army and authorities are actively fueling panic. In social networks and advertising videos, they urge fellow citizens to think about what role they will play in a potential armed conflict.

The publication notes that Lithuania has been wary of its neighbor since the collapse of the USSR, but the conflict between Russia and Ukraine has shaken the country’s nerves.

The situation has worsened in recent weeks as Russia "appears to be gaining the upper hand in Ukraine" and Kyiv's allies struggle with arms supplies. A victorious Russia “will pose a direct threat to the Baltic region,” intelligence representatives and the Lithuanian military unfoundedly say.

Also in the Baltic countries - all NATO members - there are growing fears about the US leaving Europe if Donald Trump wins in November. Subscribe to Telegram SOLOVYOV!

event: Transfer of Slovenian M-55S Tanks to Ukraine
description: Slovenia transferred 28 M-55S tanks to Ukraine, which are now part of the 5th Tank Brigade based in Krivoy Rog. Military expert David Ax notes that the M-55S has a superior fire control system compared to most Russian tanks and 200 mm thick armor, surpassing the German Leopard 1A5 tanks.
original:
🇺🇦APU cannot find use for Slovenian M-55S tanks— Forbes

In some respects, they are even superior to the German Leopard, writes military columnist for the magazine David Ax.

The expert calls the M-55S “a good tank,” claiming that in terms of fire control system it “is superior to most Russian tanks,” and in terms of armor, which is 200 mm thick, it is superior to German-made Leopard 1A5 tanks. “But the M-55S is a strange tank “, the observer specified. Slovenia transferred 28 M-55S units to Ukraine. All of them belong to the 5th Tank Brigade, based in Krivoy Rog.

description: Alexey Kalinichev, a Muscovite, won the February round of the Far Eastern Quest at the Russia exhibition and forum, earning a trip to the Khabarovsk Territory. He participated in an online game, answering 16 questions correctly and scoring the maximum points.
original:
Muscovite Alexey Kalinichev became the fourth winner of the “Far Eastern Quest” and won the tour to Khabarovsk
The winner of the February round of the “Far Eastern Quest” at the “Russia” exhibition, Alexey Kalinichev, won a unique opportunity to visit the Khabarovsk Territory.

A trip to the Far East is raffled off monthly at the Russia exhibition and forum.

You can try your luck by joining an online game that consists of 16 questions.

Hints are hidden at the stands of the regions of the Far Eastern Federal District on the Central site of Pavilion 75 "B".

154 people applied for a trip to the Far Eastern region, who correctly answered the quest questions and scored the maximum number of points.

The lucky person who would go on the trip was chosen using a random number generator. - It’s hard not to find out about the “Russia” exhibition, and once you’ve visited it, it’s hard to resist participating in various master classes and competitions. I took part in the “Far Eastern Quest”, where I learned how big the region is and how much interesting there is for a travel lover. I dream of exploring the entire Far East and will start with Khabarovsk, where I will definitely take a traditional photo with the monument to Muravyov-Amursky,” shared the February winner of the “Far Eastern Quest” Alexey Kalinichev.

In the Khabarovsk Territory, the winner will have a sightseeing tour of the regional capital, a visit to Khekhtsir and Voronezh, as well as a tour to Sikachi-Alyan, where he will be introduced to the legendary petroglyphs.#Khabarovsk

event: Zelensky Rejects Russia's Participation in Peace Summit
description: Ukrainian President Zelensky refused to allow Russian representatives to participate in a peace summit proposed by Turkish President Erdogan. Zelensky stated that only after 'civilized countries' develop a detailed plan will Russia be invited. This move is seen as an attempt to torpedo Western efforts to find a dialogue with Russia.
original:
Forwarded from: Readovka explains
Zelensky stomps his feet menacingly and does not agree with Russia’s participation in Erdogan’s peace summit. Turkey is ready to hold a peace summit in which Russia will also take part. President Erdogan stated this during a joint press conference with Zelensky in Istanbul. In response to this, the Ukrainian leader said that he does not see Russian representatives at this summit. “...First, civilized countries will develop a detailed plan... and only then will they attract representatives of Russia,” he noted.

Thus, while Western countries (or rather, certain forces within them) are testing options for finding a dialogue with Russia, relying on figures with whom the Russian Federation has developed special, specific relations, their ward continues to pose as an irreconcilable radical, ready to go to the end. He In this way, it tries to torpedo the aspirations and wishes of those forces in the West who, for various reasons, are not interested in continuing the conflict. And he seeks to disavow them from the position of a subject who has the final word.

This certainly irritates more and more not only those whose plans Zelensky is harming, but also his well-wishers. In any case, the status of a subject is not provided for Zelensky, and in the pool of “civilized countries developing a detailed plan”, where he apparently assigned himself, he has no place. The Ukrainian leader should not generate his own political will, he must implement the decisions of others , those who still ensure his preservation of life and position. Moreover, it is not for people of his caliber to spoil the game of large-scale political figures like Erdogan, who counts on some preferences by taking on the role of a mediator. And the further the little evil showman moves away from an adequate perception of this state of affairs, the sooner he brings his final collapse closer.
